title: Will Smith plants kiss on Jada as they’re joined by pink-haired Jaden
text:
The Smiths headed out (Picture: INSTAR Images)

Will Smith brought his family along with him to the Gemini Man premiere on Sunday night, with a pink-haired Jaden loving life on the red carpet.

And it’s a Smith sight to see.

The Smith family cuddled up for cameras, as Will – who stars in the film as his 51-year-old self, as well as a twenty-something version – planted a kiss on wife Jada Pinkett Smith’s forehead.

Will’s eldest son Trey, 26, also joined the crew as they posed for photos in various states of suited and booted, with Jaden, 21, (who was given an ‘intervention’ for his vegan diet by his family recently) wearing a swanky Louis Vuitton suit and grills to match.

In a resplendent gold and peach-coloured dress Jada looked amazing, while Will kept things cool and casual with a blazer over a T-shirt.

The actor plays Harry, an assassin in his fifties who has seen too much death and plans to retire. Out of nowhere, a mysterious figure starts hunting him, who turns out to be a young clone of himself (also Smith, with some motion capture trickery). Harry now must seek out his former boss (Clive Owen), the man behind all this, and avoid his younger self’s bullets without killing both of them.

Will and Jada are 23 years strong in their marriage, and also share daughter Willow, 18, however they recently revealed they were finally learning how to be in an ‘adult’ relationship with one another.

23 years strong (Picture: Getty Images North America)

Jaden showed off his fresh pink hair (Picture: INSTAR Images)

Speaking to her mum Adrienne Banfield-Jones and Chelsea Handler on her Facebook show Red Table Talk, the 48-year-old actress said: ‘I feel that I’m just now entering an adult relationship with Will.

‘After 23 years. We finally are learning to have an adult relationship.’

Red Table Talk has become known for celebrities opening up and The Smiths, well, being The Smiths.

The actress previously revealed why she and the rest of her family are always so honest about their lives and relationships when they go on her show.

In a chat with Stephen Colbert, she admitted they both wanted ‘to kind of get rid of the idea that people in the public eye have perfect relationships’.

‘We were kind of sick of living up to that,’ she said.

‘We were real sick of it. And then second of all, really having myself and Will come and talk about our relationship – sometimes you see just women do it alone or you just see a guy do it.’
